etymologies: mid 16th century: from medieval Latin registratio(n-), based on Latin regerere ‘enter, record’ (see register)

definitions: the action or process of registering or of being registered

examples.text: the registration of births, marriages, and deaths
the number of new private car registrations has increased

shortDefinitions: action or process of registering or of being registered

definitions: a certificate that attests to the registering of a person, automobile, etc.
shortDefinitions: certificate that attests to registering of person, car, etc.

definitions: a combination of stops used when playing the organ.
shortDefinitions: combination of stops used when playing organ
